snippet.textDisplay:
Be a hermit so you don't have the chance to get it.
I'm on IVIG (it contains both antibodies for the SARS-COV2 virus and variants as well as cross reactive antibodies to the SARS-COV2 virus) and I make an effort (about 95%) to be a hermit.
I will only go out to grab my shopping and to see the doctors.

snippet.textDisplay: haha what kind of recommendation is that? Just a little priviliged people in the world could do that. Otherwise, what kind of life is that? To be forced to be a hermit is not living at all.

snippet.textDisplay: @Leslie Hyde you say "From what I understand, if you don't have the parts that a virus latches onto in order to infect you, survive you and spread from you the virus isn't likely to infect you, survive in you and spread from you. " ok, so why are you at risk & isolating again?
snippet.textOriginal: @Leslie Hyde you say "From what I understand, if you don't have the parts that a virus latches onto in order to infect you, survive you and spread from you the virus isn't likely to infect you, survive in you and spread from you. " ok, so why are you at risk & isolating again?

snippet.textDisplay:
@Maria Hewitt I'm using OTHER people's natural immunity. I get two types of dosing- maintenance (once per month every month no matter what) and acute (one dose per day for 5 days- this happens whenever I have a CIDP exacerbation [1. CIDP- chronic inflammatory demylanating polyneuropathy- my immune system attacks my nervous system, with the most notable effects on my spinal cord; 2. Exacerbation- a temporary flare of symptoms in which I have temporary ascending paralysis]). 
BTW, it's a super expensive blood product with many risks (life altering) so it is only given for certain conditions in which there has been proven a massive benefit (life altering).
